::: {.callout-note}
This format emphasises **contributions and impact**, rather than job titles or
publication counts. Evidence is linked where possible.
:::



This **Résumé for Research** follows a narrative CV format commonly used by research
funders. Contributions are organised into four modules.  
Each entry should clearly state **what you contributed**, **why it matters**, and
**where the evidence can be found**.

---

## 1. Contributions to the generation of knowledge

<!--
PROMPT:
Describe 2–4 key contributions.
For each, aim for:
- What you contributed (method, data, insight)
- Why it matters scientifically
- Evidence (paper, preprint, repository, report)
-->

::: {.card}
**Contribution title or short claim**

- **Contribution:** <!-- What you did -->
- **Significance:** <!-- Why this matters -->
- **Evidence:** <!-- Link(s) -->
:::

---

## 2. Contributions to the development of others

<!--
PROMPT:
Think broadly:
- Supervision or mentoring
- Teaching or training
- Onboarding materials, documentation
- Informal support that enabled others
-->

::: {.card}
**Contribution title or short claim**

- **Contribution:** <!-- e.g. supervision, mentoring, teaching -->
- **Who benefited:** <!-- students, colleagues, teams -->
- **Evidence:** <!-- projects, materials, acknowledgements -->
:::
